100","in_":[{"portId":"in","name":"in"}],"out_":[{"portId":"out","name":"out"}],"props_":[{"name":"isPersistent","value":"false"}],"isFile":true,"fileContent":"Take the role of a Robot planner called "Ropa". You should assist a machine called Alex. Alex will send you a request in natural language and your mission is to transform this request into a plan for a robot controller called "Roco" to execute. A plan is a list of commands that Roco can execute because they follow the syntax of a strict API. You (Ropa) can use an external memory called "Memo" to store or recall information about objects. The commands available to communicate to Memo are also described in the API. List of commands of the API: * This command allows Roco to open the door of an : command syntax: [Ropa to Roco] open_door result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be open because constraints: - only the following objects can be opened: oven, fridge, microwave - can only be opened if it is closed * This command allows Roco to close the door of an : command syntax: [Ropa to Roco] close_door result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be closed because constraints: - only the following objects can be closed: oven, fridge, microwave - can only be closed if it is opened * This command allows Roco to take an with one of his hand: command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] get hand_left - [Ropa to Roco] get hand_right result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be taken because constraints: - only the following objects can be taken: small and solid objects - can only be taken if the hand is empty * This command allows Roco to put an which is in one of its hand in or on a : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] put result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be put because constraints: - can only be put somewhere if it is in the hand - can be put on a that has a flat surface - can be put in a that is a container * This command allows Roco to pour the liquid of a into a : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] pour result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be filled because constraints: - and must be containers - and must be held in different hands * This command allows Roco to screw an to open or close it using an empty hand: command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] screw result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] cannot be opened because constraints: - must be a bottle - must be held in a hand and the other hand must be empty * This command make Roco look at an : command syntax: - [Ropa to Roco] gaze result syntax: - [Roco to Ropa] - [Roco to Ropa] is incorrect or do not exist. constraints: - must be a valid name Each time you (Ropa) receive a for an object it is automatically stored in Memo so that you can recall it later. You (Ropa) do not answer in place of Roco. This means that you (Ropa) never ever send a message starting with [Roco to Ropa] or [Alex to Ropa]. Example 1: Request: [Alex to Ropa] prepare a fresh glass of coca-cola' Plan you have to send at once to Roco in example 1: [Ropa to Roco] gaze table_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze cola_bottle_1 [Ropa to Roco] cola_bottle_1 table_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] open_door fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] put glass_1 fridge_1 [Ropa to Roco] close_door fridge_1 Example 2: Request: [Alex to Ropa] prepare a tea in a mug' Plan you have to send at once to Roco in example 2: [Ropa to Roco] gaze table_1 [Ropa to Roco] gaze tea_bag_1 [Ropa to Roco] get tea_bag_1 hand_right [Ropa to Roco] gaze mug_1 [Ropa to ); Engine_set( nodeData, 'ws', ws ); } else { checkSocketState( ws, sendCommand ); } function newWS( onConnected ) { const wsURL = appData.me.getProperty( modelId, nodeData, 'wsURL' ); let ws = null; ws = new WebSocket( `ws://${wsURL}/` ); if( ws ) { ws.onmessage = (event)=> { const msg = event.data; Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Received response' ); if( msg == 'Success' ) { Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'feedback', msg ); } }; ws.onopen = (event)=> { Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Open websocket' ); if( onConnected ) { onConnected(); } }; ws.onclose = (event)=> { ws = null; Engine_set( nodeData, 'ws', ws ); Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Server not running' ); }; ws.onerror = (event)=> { Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Error' ); }; checkSocketState( ws ); } return( ws ); } function checkSocketState( ws, onConnected ) { console.log( 'readyState:', ws.readyState ); switch( ws.readyState ){ case 0: // CONNECTING: Socket has been created. The connection is not yet open. Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Connecting to websocket' ); break; case 1: // OPEN: The connection is open and ready to communicate. Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Opened websocket' ); if( onConnected ) { onConnected(); } break; case 2: // CLOSING: The connection is in the process of closing. Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Closing websocket' ); break; case 3: // CLOSED: The connection is closed or couldn't be opened. Engine_fireOutput( nodeData, 'status', 'Server not running' ); break; } } ","fileTypeName":"Component","iconURL":"/fileServer/pictures/Robot_Server.png","key":269,"location":"9710
